com.here.android.mpa.customlocation2

Class CLE2PolygonGeometry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.customlocation2.CLE2Geometry
      • com.here.android.mpa.customlocation2.CLE2PolygonGeometry

  • public final class CLE2PolygonGeometry
extends CLE2Geometry
    Specifies a user-defined polygon geometry. The polygon geometry represent a list of GeoPolygon

    Note: The concept of polygon in WKT (Well Known Text) format consists of one outer ring/polygon, plus zero or more inner rings/polygons. We map the WKT concept here with a GeoPolygon outer ring object, and a list of GeoPolygon as the inner rings (if any).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CLE2PolygonGeometry(GeoPolygon outerRing)
      Creates a new polygon geometry without any holes.
      CLE2PolygonGeometry(GeoPolygon outerRing, java.util.List<GeoPolygon> innerRings)
      Creates a new polygon geometry with outer ring (shape) and inner rings (holes).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      void setPolygon(GeoPolygon outerRing)
      Sets the shape of this polygon to a solid one without any holes.
      void setPolygon(GeoPolygon outerRing, java.util.List<GeoPolygon> innerRings)
      Sets the geometry of this polygon with outer ring (shape) and inner rings (holes).

    • Constructor Detail

      • CLE2PolygonGeometry

        public CLE2PolygonGeometry(GeoPolygon outerRing,
                           java.util.List<GeoPolygon> innerRings)
        Creates a new polygon geometry with outer ring (shape) and inner rings (holes). Input polygons can be "closed" (ie. having the same first and last vertex) or not, both options are valid.
        Parameters:
        outerRing - the outer boundary of the polygon, defining its shape
        innerRings - list if inner rings of the polygon, defining holes in the main shape, will be ignored if null or empty
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when outerRing is null or invalid, meaning it is not a polygon with an area greater than 0, or when innerRings contains null or invalid elements

      • CLE2PolygonGeometry

        public CLE2PolygonGeometry(GeoPolygon outerRing)
        Creates a new polygon geometry without any holes.
        Parameters:
        outerRing - the outer boundary of the polygon, defining it's shape
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when outerRing is null or invalid, meaning it is not a polygon with an area greater than 0

    • Method Detail

      • getOuterRing

        public GeoPolygon getOuterRing()
        Gets the outer ring GeoPolygon of this geometry. The polygon returned by this method is always "closed", meaning that its last vertex is the same as the first one.
        Returns:
        GeoPolygon defining the shape of this polygon

      • getInnerRings

        public java.util.List<GeoPolygon> getInnerRings()
        Gets the all inner ring of this geometry. The polygons returned by this method are always "closed", meaning that its last vertex is the same as the first one.
        Returns:
        a list of GeoPolygon defining holes in the polygon

      • setPolygon

        public void setPolygon(GeoPolygon outerRing)
        Sets the shape of this polygon to a solid one without any holes.
        Parameters:
        outerRing - the outer boundary of the polygon, defining its shape
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when outerRing is null or invalid, meaning it is not a polygon with an area greater than 0

      • setPolygon

        public void setPolygon(GeoPolygon outerRing,
                       java.util.List<GeoPolygon> innerRings)
        Sets the geometry of this polygon with outer ring (shape) and inner rings (holes). Input polygons can be "closed" (ie. having the same first and last vertex) or not, both options are valid.
        Parameters:
        outerRing - the outer boundary of the polygon, defining its shape
        innerRings - list if inner rings of the polygon, defining holes in the main shape, will be ignored if null or empty
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when outerRing is null or invalid, meaning it is not a polygon with an area greater than 0, or when innerRings contains null or invalid elements
